class.name: STTConfig
class.brief_description: Stores filenames and variables for [i]Pocketsphinx[/i] speech to text.
class.description: Contains filenames and variables needed for speech to text using the internal [i]Pocketsphinx[/i] library. Instances of this class supply information to [STTRunner] objects.
class.demos: [b]Color Clutter[/b], a simple Godot game that uses speech to text, is available on the following link: https://github.com/SamuraiSigma/color-clutter

method.name: init
method.description: Initializes [i]Pocketsphinx[/i] speech to text variables. The attributes for HMM directory name, dictionary filename and keywords filename must have been previously defined with the appropriate setters. Returns One of the following [STTError] values: - [member STTError.OK] - [member STTError.UNDEF_FILES_ERR] - [member STTError.USER_DIR_MAKE_ERR] - [member STTError.USER_DIR_COPY_ERR] - [member STTError.MULTIBYTE_STR_ERR] - [member STTError.MEMALLOC_ERR] - [member STTError.CONFIG_CREATE_ERR] - [member STTError.REC_CREATE_ERR] - [member STTError.DECODER_CREATE_ERR] [i]Note:[/i] - See [method set_hmm_dirname] for setting the HMM directory name - See [method set_dict_filename] for setting the dictionary filename - See [method set_kws_filename] for setting the keywords filename

members.member: A text file containing words in the desired language, along with the phonemes for their pronunciation. These phonemes are defined in the [member hmm directory]. Exemplifying, for US English, the word [b]red[/b] would have the following line in the dictionary file: [code]red R EH D[/code] For more on building dictionary files, check the following link: https://cmusphinx.github.io/wiki/tutorialdict

The HMM (Hidden Markov Model) directory name. Known simply as the model, it contains a collection of files which statistically describe the language to be used. [i]CMUSphinx[/i], which created, [i]Pocketsphinx[/i] library, has a few language models available for free use on the following link: [b]https://sourceforge.net/projects/cmusphinx/files/Acoustic%20and%20Language%20Models[/b]

Refers to a text file where every line contains a word and its respective detection threshold, isolated between [code]/[/code] characters. Each word must exist in the [member dictionary file]. An example of a line in this file for the word [b]red[/b] would be: [code]red/1e-4/[/code]
